post.body:
Edit on 2006-01-09: Skip to this post on page 7 for info on the latest version:
viewtopic.php?t=1281&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=120

Download here:
http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar


Screenshot


OUTDATED INFO:

Ok, now it´s time to release a (not yet perfect) version of this md5viewer.
I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
yes I know that when you let the animation run backwards, at some point the absolute animation time becomes negative, and the animation time is clamped to 0.
I thought that that´s the most reasonable behaviour for the animation.

Yes I know, the font rendering is really poopy... But I didn´t really want to concentrate on that boring stuff too much, so I chose to get some example code from some tutorial and if it works I won´t touch it.


So has anyone tried it out with the Doom3 Models? Don´t forget to set the path variable in the scene.txt file to your D3-base-directory.

And then you can try setting the nummodels to 7 (was 5 in the original scene.txt). Maybe you´ve noticed that the scene.txt contains two more models, #5 and #6, that have been ignored. That´s kind of an easter egg... lol.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Thank you guys for all the feedback.

First of all, don´t use paths with spaces in them. Not even if you put the pathnames in " " ...

In the included scene.txt, you can just make two changes and you´ll see pinky breaking through the walls (if you have the alpha ofcourse):
- change the first line that says basepath, to point to the base dir of the alpha.
- change the line that says "nummodels 3" to "nummodels 5". The models number 3 and 4 (count starts at zero so it´s 5 models then) are pinky and the wall. The other models (number 0, 1 and 2) will still be there.
Yeah this is inconvenient, it would be easier to handle if the numbers were just left out and all the models in the scene.txt would be read. Ofcourse the best thing would be on the fly model loading like rich pointed out.

matt, what exactly do you mean with the "skinless" pinky? is it white, completely without textures?

post.body:
That's a great little app der_ton, very impressive - definitely the best one I've seen so far. I'm trying a similar normal-mapped app myself, and since I got the doom3 models & normal maps I figured I'd use them to learn how to do it. So I have a few technical questions if you don't mind! (that is if you still hang around here..)

Are you using tangent-space bump-mapping? This is what I've been trying, but I haven't been having too much success. I'm using a vertex program to set it up, and then register combiners to do the dot product. However it all seems to be far too bright, compared with just standard opengl lighting. Also, the diffuse map seems to be very washed out - the model doesn't show up half the detail that should be there. I know this is a little vague, and if you're willing to answer a few questions I'll go into greater detail, but I just thought you might have come across the same sort of problems as me, and might be able to point me in the right direction!

I'm not doing specular yet, since once I have this figured out then it shouldnt be too hard to extend it to include a gloss map. And I'm not using the height map texture either, just the base texture map and the normal map - would this be something to do with my problems?

satch

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: I MAY SOUND STUPID BUT IM TRYING TO CREATE CUTSCENES FOR MY NEW MAP USING der_TONS MOD VIEWER AND I CAN LOAD THE MD5 MESH MODEL OF THE Doom 3 Marine but his texture isnt there whats the problem

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

post.author: ukrul

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Ok, the basepath in the scene.txt should be "c:\models\", and the folder that you named "model" has to be renamed to "models", so that your models and textures are in c:\models\models\...
That's because the folder in the base folder has to be named "models", if you don't want to edit all the shader names in the md5 files. The point is that the shader names have to give the modelviewer a clue as to where the textures are (relative to the basepath).

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Right, you have to extract the textures too. Like I wrote in the viewer's readme, it doesn't extract the pk4 files automatically.

In some cases, the shader names do not correspond with the tga names (because the shader references the tgas in the .mtr files). The modelviewer doesn't read these .mtr files, and some textures will not display unless you modify the shader in the md5 file (make a copy and edit it with a text editor).

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Edit on 2006-01-09: Skip to this post on page 7 for info on the latest version:
viewtopic.php?t=1281&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=120

Download here:
http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar


Screenshot


OUTDATED INFO:

Ok, now it´s time to release a (not yet perfect) version of this md5viewer.
I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

Thank you guys for all the feedback.

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

post.author: ukrul

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Ok, the basepath in the scene.txt should be "c:\models\", and the folder that you named "model" has to be renamed to "models", so that your models and textures are in c:\models\models\...
That's because the folder in the base folder has to be named "models", if you don't want to edit all the shader names in the md5 files. The point is that the shader names have to give the modelviewer a clue as to where the textures are (relative to the basepath).

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Right, you have to extract the textures too. Like I wrote in the viewer's readme, it doesn't extract the pk4 files automatically.

In some cases, the shader names do not correspond with the tga names (because the shader references the tgas in the .mtr files). The modelviewer doesn't read these .mtr files, and some textures will not display unless you modify the shader in the md5 file (make a copy and edit it with a text editor).

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Edit on 2006-01-09: Skip to this post on page 7 for info on the latest version:
viewtopic.php?t=1281&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=120

Download here:
http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar


Screenshot


OUTDATED INFO:

Ok, now it´s time to release a (not yet perfect) version of this md5viewer.
I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar

Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

_________________
Macbear Chen 麥克熊

macbearchen
 Post subject:
Posted: Fri Mar 25, 2005 3:32 am 
The first 10 posts have been the best...

Joined: Thu Oct 02, 2003 9:10 am
Posts: 10
Location: Taipei, Taiwan
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

_________________

Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2525
Location: Munich, Germany
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

der_ton
 Post subject:
Posted: Mon Jul 11, 2005 9:53 am 
Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2525
Location: Munich, Germany
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

Hi all!

I have to suggest some new features for der_ton model viewer to improve a better workflow when you work with it.

* priority
** secondary

-=Workflow=-

*
- Read config model in def files for quick navigation between model's sequences.
- Display names of bones in a short list dialog to select bones and highlightning the bone selected in viewport's model viewer, i suggest a new tab called Bones.

**
- Move to player view for better preview weapons animation.


-=Render=-

*
- Sketch render (uniform lightning) like this :

- Hide geometry for better understanding rigging model (bones only)

**
- Display influence Bones (weight map)


-=Textures=-

**
- New Materials tab to display model's texture on model viewer viewport.


If you have any other suggest for improve model viewer you can post it here =)

Bye!

a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2528
Location: Munich, Germany
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

 Post subject:
Posted: Mon Jul 11, 2005 9:53 am 
Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2528
Location: Munich, Germany
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: doomkid3000
post.body: link broken

post.author: Dogstar
post.body: No it ain't. I just downloaded the file.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

macbearchen
 Post subject:
Posted: Fri Mar 25, 2005 3:32 am 
The first 10 posts have been the best...

Joined: Thu Oct 02, 2003 9:10 am
Posts: 10
Location: Taipei, Taiwan
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

_________________

Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2527
Location: Munich, Germany
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)

der_ton
 Post subject:
Posted: Mon Jul 11, 2005 9:53 am 
Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2527
Location: Munich, Germany
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

- Hide geometry for better understanding rigging model (bones only)

**
- Display influence Bones (weight map)


-=Textures=-

**

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

OUTDATED INFO:

Ok, now it´s time to release a (not yet perfect) version of this md5viewer.
I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
yes I know that when you let the animation run backwards, at some point the absolute animation time becomes negative, and the animation time is clamped to 0.
I thought that that´s the most reasonable behaviour for the animation.

Yes I know, the font rendering is really poopy... But I didn´t really want to concentrate on that boring stuff too much, so I chose to get some example code from some tutorial and if it works I won´t touch it.


So has anyone tried it out with the Doom3 Models? Don´t forget to set the path variable in the scene.txt file to your D3-base-directory.

And then you can try setting the nummodels to 7 (was 5 in the original scene.txt). Maybe you´ve noticed that the scene.txt contains two more models, #5 and #6, that have been ignored. That´s kind of an easter egg... lol.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Thank you guys for all the feedback.

First of all, don´t use paths with spaces in them. Not even if you put the pathnames in " " ...

In the included scene.txt, you can just make two changes and you´ll see pinky breaking through the walls (if you have the alpha ofcourse):
- change the first line that says basepath, to point to the base dir of the alpha.
- change the line that says "nummodels 3" to "nummodels 5". The models number 3 and 4 (count starts at zero so it´s 5 models then) are pinky and the wall. The other models (number 0, 1 and 2) will still be there.
Yeah this is inconvenient, it would be easier to handle if the numbers were just left out and all the models in the scene.txt would be read. Ofcourse the best thing would be on the fly model loading like rich pointed out.

matt, what exactly do you mean with the "skinless" pinky? is it white, completely without textures?

I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: _shank
post.body:
neat...dont know much bout it...but just appreciating the effort u put in

the butterfly stopped flapping after i did shift + x(after the initial fast flapping)

post.author: KPixel
post.body:
Really nice !

On side note : The rendering of font (when rendering help) really kill FPS

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
yes I know that when you let the animation run backwards, at some point the absolute animation time becomes negative, and the animation time is clamped to 0.
I thought that that´s the most reasonable behaviour for the animation.

Yes I know, the font rendering is really poopy... But I didn´t really want to concentrate on that boring stuff too much, so I chose to get some example code from some tutorial and if it works I won´t touch it.


So has anyone tried it out with the Doom3 Models? Don´t forget to set the path variable in the scene.txt file to your D3-base-directory.

And then you can try setting the nummodels to 7 (was 5 in the original scene.txt). Maybe you´ve noticed that the scene.txt contains two more models, #5 and #6, that have been ignored. That´s kind of an easter egg... lol.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
There´s a new version,
http://www.doom3world.org/doom3/der_ton/modelviewer.zip

-improved specular lighting on Geforce3+
-switch the object in focus (thanks rich)
-improved flexibility for camera movement
-can draw character skeletons
-reads obj and ase models, too

Nothing stunning, but I felt like improving it a little more.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Thank you guys for all the feedback.

First of all, don´t use paths with spaces in them. Not even if you put the pathnames in " " ...

In the included scene.txt, you can just make two changes and you´ll see pinky breaking through the walls (if you have the alpha ofcourse):
- change the first line that says basepath, to point to the base dir of the alpha.
- change the line that says "nummodels 3" to "nummodels 5". The models number 3 and 4 (count starts at zero so it´s 5 models then) are pinky and the wall. The other models (number 0, 1 and 2) will still be there.
Yeah this is inconvenient, it would be easier to handle if the numbers were just left out and all the models in the scene.txt would be read. Ofcourse the best thing would be on the fly model loading like rich pointed out.

matt, what exactly do you mean with the "skinless" pinky? is it white, completely without textures?

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: Oh, I just had another idea. Being able to move the models around in the scene maybe with shift + mousedrag or something. You probably are starting to hate me now.

post.author: bb_matt
post.body:
der_ton wrote:
matt, what exactly do you mean with the "skinless" pinky? is it white, completely without textures?


Yeah - it was just me being dumb and not editing the basepath !

It looks a lot better skinned - hehe - great stuff.

post.author: satchmo
post.body:
That's a great little app der_ton, very impressive - definitely the best one I've seen so far. I'm trying a similar normal-mapped app myself, and since I got the doom3 models & normal maps I figured I'd use them to learn how to do it. So I have a few technical questions if you don't mind! (that is if you still hang around here..)

Are you using tangent-space bump-mapping? This is what I've been trying, but I haven't been having too much success. I'm using a vertex program to set it up, and then register combiners to do the dot product. However it all seems to be far too bright, compared with just standard opengl lighting. Also, the diffuse map seems to be very washed out - the model doesn't show up half the detail that should be there. I know this is a little vague, and if you're willing to answer a few questions I'll go into greater detail, but I just thought you might have come across the same sort of problems as me, and might be able to point me in the right direction!

I'm not doing specular yet, since once I have this figured out then it shouldnt be too hard to extend it to include a gloss map. And I'm not using the height map texture either, just the base texture map and the normal map - would this be something to do with my problems?

Here's an example:...
<<screenshot removed>>


Thanks!
satch

Thank you guys for all the feedback.

First of all, don´t use paths with spaces in them. Not even if you put the pathnames in " " ...

In the included scene.txt, you can just make two changes and you´ll see pinky breaking through the walls (if you have the alpha ofcourse):
- change the first line that says basepath, to point to the base dir of the alpha.
- change the line that says "nummodels 3" to "nummodels 5". The models number 3 and 4 (count starts at zero so it´s 5 models then) are pinky and the wall. The other models (number 0, 1 and 2) will still be there.
Yeah this is inconvenient, it would be easier to handle if the numbers were just left out and all the models in the scene.txt would be read. Ofcourse the best thing would be on the fly model loading like rich pointed out.

matt, what exactly do you mean with the "skinless" pinky? is it white, completely without textures?

That's a great little app der_ton, very impressive - definitely the best one I've seen so far. I'm trying a similar normal-mapped app myself, and since I got the doom3 models & normal maps I figured I'd use them to learn how to do it. So I have a few technical questions if you don't mind! (that is if you still hang around here..)

Are you using tangent-space bump-mapping? This is what I've been trying, but I haven't been having too much success. I'm using a vertex program to set it up, and then register combiners to do the dot product. However it all seems to be far too bright, compared with just standard opengl lighting. Also, the diffuse map seems to be very washed out - the model doesn't show up half the detail that should be there. I know this is a little vague, and if you're willing to answer a few questions I'll go into greater detail, but I just thought you might have come across the same sort of problems as me, and might be able to point me in the right direction!

I'm not doing specular yet, since once I have this figured out then it shouldnt be too hard to extend it to include a gloss map. And I'm not using the height map texture either, just the base texture map and the normal map - would this be something to do with my problems?

Here's an example:...
<<screenshot removed>>


Thanks!
satch

shadowdragon
 Post subject:

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Edit on 2006-01-09: Skip to this post on page 7 for info on the latest version:
viewtopic.php?t=1281&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=120

Download here:
http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar


Screenshot


OUTDATED INFO:

Ok, now it´s time to release a (not yet perfect) version of this md5viewer.
I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: _shank
post.body:
neat...dont know much bout it...but just appreciating the effort u put in

the butterfly stopped flapping after i did shift + x(after the initial fast flapping)

post.author: KPixel
post.body:
Really nice !

On side note : The rendering of font (when rendering help) really kill FPS

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
yes I know that when you let the animation run backwards, at some point the absolute animation time becomes negative, and the animation time is clamped to 0.
I thought that that´s the most reasonable behaviour for the animation.

Yes I know, the font rendering is really poopy... But I didn´t really want to concentrate on that boring stuff too much, so I chose to get some example code from some tutorial and if it works I won´t touch it.


So has anyone tried it out with the Doom3 Models? Don´t forget to set the path variable in the scene.txt file to your D3-base-directory.

And then you can try setting the nummodels to 7 (was 5 in the original scene.txt). Maybe you´ve noticed that the scene.txt contains two more models, #5 and #6, that have been ignored. That´s kind of an easter egg... lol.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
There´s a new version,
http://www.doom3world.org/doom3/der_ton/modelviewer.zip

-improved specular lighting on Geforce3+
-switch the object in focus (thanks rich)
-improved flexibility for camera movement
-can draw character skeletons
-reads obj and ase models, too

Nothing stunning, but I felt like improving it a little more.

Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Thank you guys for all the feedback.

First of all, don´t use paths with spaces in them. Not even if you put the pathnames in " " ...

In the included scene.txt, you can just make two changes and you´ll see pinky breaking through the walls (if you have the alpha ofcourse):
- change the first line that says basepath, to point to the base dir of the alpha.
- change the line that says "nummodels 3" to "nummodels 5". The models number 3 and 4 (count starts at zero so it´s 5 models then) are pinky and the wall. The other models (number 0, 1 and 2) will still be there.
Yeah this is inconvenient, it would be easier to handle if the numbers were just left out and all the models in the scene.txt would be read. Ofcourse the best thing would be on the fly model loading like rich pointed out.

matt, what exactly do you mean with the "skinless" pinky? is it white, completely without textures?

post.author: satchmo

That's a great little app der_ton, very impressive - definitely the best one I've seen so far. I'm trying a similar normal-mapped app myself, and since I got the doom3 models & normal maps I figured I'd use them to learn how to do it. So I have a few technical questions if you don't mind! (that is if you still hang around here..)

Are you using tangent-space bump-mapping? This is what I've been trying, but I haven't been having too much success. I'm using a vertex program to set it up, and then register combiners to do the dot product. However it all seems to be far too bright, compared with just standard opengl lighting. Also, the diffuse map seems to be very washed out - the model doesn't show up half the detail that should be there. I know this is a little vague, and if you're willing to answer a few questions I'll go into greater detail, but I just thought you might have come across the same sort of problems as me, and might be able to point me in the right direction!

I'm not doing specular yet, since once I have this figured out then it shouldnt be too hard to extend it to include a gloss map. And I'm not using the height map texture either, just the base texture map and the normal map - would this be something to do with my problems?

Here's an example:...
<<screenshot removed>>


Thanks!
satch

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: der ton on page 4 you spoke of changing a shader line on the player.md5mesh so it would recognize the upper body textures what was it you changed by the way thanks for all your help lately i really appreciate it seriously

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

Bye!

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
doomkid3000 wrote:

Yep, F8 reloads the textures. Undocumented feature...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Edit on 2006-01-09: Skip to this post on page 7 for info on the latest version:
viewtopic.php?t=1281&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=120

Download here:
http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar


Screenshot


OUTDATED INFO:

Ok, now it´s time to release a (not yet perfect) version of this md5viewer.
I included some md5models (one of them animated), which will probably be the bigger attractor for most of you, since there are several md5viewers out there (none of them technically as advanced as mine, though , but I haven´t seen ANY selfmade md5model/anim ever.
But don´t expect too much of the models, they´re made with notepad, and my texture creation skills are flat zero, and the butterfly texture is taken from NVidia´s Dawn demo...

Link to the old thread with screenshots:
http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=1139

Here´s the link, thanks to BNA! for uploading it!
updated a few times now, this is the latest version (see my posting from 2004-01-16 below):
http://home.tiscali.de/der_ton/modelviewer.rar

To view other models that you might have , edit the scene.txt file. I hope it´s self-explanatory. And you guys just LOVE anything that looks like a ascii-script, right? ;-D

Sorry for the shitty specular lighting... it´s difficult to do that in a optically correct way with 4 texture units and using no NV or ATI extension. I´ll either add a codepath for NV_register_combiner extension, or add support for 8 texture units, or I´ll go all the way to ARB_fragment_program.

The framerate is not good, I know, but this is not optimized yet. And I don´t have any assembly language inner loops, not to mention MMX/SSE stuff. And it doesn´t use vertex programs (yet), so all the math is done by the CPU.
And the framerate used to be twice as high, until I had to restructure the tangent space calculation because of the symmetry seam issue.

There was so much more that I wanted to mention about the program, but let´s do it the other way round, just ask questions of what you want to know. I´m switching to lazy mode now.

der_ton

post.author: _shank
post.body:
neat...dont know much bout it...but just appreciating the effort u put in

the butterfly stopped flapping after i did shift + x(after the initial fast flapping)

post.author: KPixel
post.body:
Really nice !

On side note : The rendering of font (when rendering help) really kill FPS

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
yes I know that when you let the animation run backwards, at some point the absolute animation time becomes negative, and the animation time is clamped to 0.
I thought that that´s the most reasonable behaviour for the animation.

Yes I know, the font rendering is really poopy... But I didn´t really want to concentrate on that boring stuff too much, so I chose to get some example code from some tutorial and if it works I won´t touch it.


So has anyone tried it out with the Doom3 Models? Don´t forget to set the path variable in the scene.txt file to your D3-base-directory.

And then you can try setting the nummodels to 7 (was 5 in the original scene.txt). Maybe you´ve noticed that the scene.txt contains two more models, #5 and #6, that have been ignored. That´s kind of an easter egg... lol.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
rich_is_bored wrote:
I set it up to search my base directory but the only model it loaded was the pipes. How do you switch the object in focus?


Sorry, no focus switching yet...

Sorry, the problem with pinky is very simple to solve.
For pinky´s "modelname" attribute in the scene file, use "maps\fred\bathroom/scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh"

The background for the sidenote that I wrote into the scene.txt is that pinky´s texture cannot be found in all the other pinky meshes that exist in the alpha, only this scene1pinkymesh.md5mesh works. That´s because the texture name in the meshfile is "wrong" for all the other pinky-meshes. Doom3 doesn´t care about that texture name since it reads the mtr file to see what textures to use for pinky, but my viewer doesn´t bother looking up the mtr file but tries to find the texture that´s written there in the mesh.

I found out that there´s a pinky mesh with the correct texture name just now, sorry. I always used a edited version of one of the other pinky-meshes.

By the way, if you want to see the scene with the two security guys and the scientist that bumps into one of them, put this into your scene.txt (instead of all the other modelstuff there):

nummodels 3

model 0
modelname "models\md5\meshes/scientist1.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sci.md5anim"
modelpos 195.791 -102.819 0

model 1
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec1.md5anim"
modelpos -145.609 193.743 0

model 2
modelname "models\md5\meshes/security.md5mesh"
modelanim "models\md5\anims\cinematics/cin_lobby_sec2.md5anim"
modelangle 0
modelpos 219.212 36.194 0

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
There´s a new version,
http://www.doom3world.org/doom3/der_ton/modelviewer.zip

-improved specular lighting on Geforce3+
-switch the object in focus (thanks rich)
-improved flexibility for camera movement
-can draw character skeletons
-reads obj and ase models, too

Nothing stunning, but I felt like improving it a little more.

post.body: downloaded for a looksee..

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
You know what would be real nice is if you could change the models/animations being rendered without editing the scene.txt. Perhaps a shortcut key to bring up a browse window for the model in focus which allows you to select a md5 model or animation. Then the selected model or animation would replace the model or animation in focus.

It's still a great piece of software der_ton.
