post.body: Yes I edit the scene file and unzip the textures but the program dont load the textures. This is the complete root where i unzip the models and animation of the monsters and i write this in the scene file C:\Models\model\md5\monsters and the textures are in C:\Models\model\monsters.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Ok, the basepath in the scene.txt should be "c:\models\", and the folder that you named "model" has to be renamed to "models", so that your models and textures are in c:\models\models\...
That's because the folder in the base folder has to be named "models", if you don't want to edit all the shader names in the md5 files. The point is that the shader names have to give the modelviewer a clue as to where the textures are (relative to the basepath).

post.author: ukrul
post.body: I change the folder and i edit again th scene file but nothing happens, thanks der_ton for your answer.

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Take a look at the debuglog.txt, there you can read where the modelviewer attempts to read the tgas from.

post.author: ukrul
post.body: Finally the texture of the models load. I have edited the md5mesh file and add this "/" in the beginning of the string in each shader line, this is an example of the new line "/models/monsters/hellknight/hellknight". Thanks for all help.

post.author: der_ton
post.body: It's easier if you put the basepath correct. That would be "c:\models\" instead of "c:\models", for example.

post.author: Chesh
post.body:
Feel Free to yell at me if this has been asked, but do the alphas work?

I had to set the paths up as folows to get the texuters to work, so maybe it has something to do with it.

I set the path to find the base folder "c:\doom3\base

then i put the unpaked models folder in my doom3/base folder.

This is the only way i could get to textures to work, but the alphas do not.

I really dig this lil viewer btw, but i could use a lil help with this.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I'm not sure what you mean with alphas. The textures that are semitranslucent/blended? They should load up and display completely opaque, because I'm not checking the material definitions to see how they should be rendered.
You might have to make a copy of the md5mesh and change the shader line to directly reference the diffuse color tga. In order to find out which tga that is, you have to first look up the material definition of that shader (in one of the material files, for monsters its monsters.mtr).

post.author: Giggione
post.body:
A littel question?

I must extract the content of all pak files in order to view the doom 3 models ??

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Yes, to view a particular model, you only have to extract the md5mesh file, along with that model's textures if you want to see them. At this point, the viewer doesn't load models and textures from within the pk4 files.

post.author: DaNg3R
post.body:
why i'm not able to watch the textures??

i extracted md5 files and animations but...........

maybe i should extract textures too...

reply plz

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Right, you have to extract the textures too. Like I wrote in the viewer's readme, it doesn't extract the pk4 files automatically.

In some cases, the shader names do not correspond with the tga names (because the shader references the tgas in the .mtr files). The modelviewer doesn't read these .mtr files, and some textures will not display unless you modify the shader in the md5 file (make a copy and edit it with a text editor).

post.author: DaNg3R
post.body: tnx 1k

post.author: CHaSE
post.body:
der_ton
Could you please add a viewer version number to the rar archive name and update the first post of the thread? Just to make things less confusing when looking for a latest version...

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Not a bad idea. But that means that the download URL will change with every version. And people will have to check at least the first post of the thread anyway to see if there's a new version. But yep, I'll do that with the next release.

post.author: KPixel
post.body:
You can solve this problem by having each file with its version + a "modelviewer_lastest.rar" that you overwrite at each release so that those that want the lastest version just pick this one...
And I think that it is important that the first post is edited at each release to tell what is the last version available.

<!--
/*
  The original subSilver Theme for phpBB version 2+
  Created by subBlue design
  /web/20070509181516/http://www.subblue.com

  NOTE: These CSS definitions are stored within the main page body so that you can use the phpBB2
  theme administration centre. When you have finalised your style you could cut the final CSS code
  and place it in an external file, deleting this section to save bandwidth.
*/

/* General page style. The scroll bar colours only visible in IE5.5+ */
body {
	background-color: #E5E5E5;
	scrollbar-face-color: #DEE3E7;
	scrollbar-highlight-color: #FFFFFF;
	scrollbar-shadow-color: #DEE3E7;
	scrollbar-3dlight-color: #D1D7DC;
	scrollbar-arrow-color:  #006699;
	scrollbar-track-color: #EFEFEF;
	scrollbar-darkshadow-color: #98AAB1;
}

/* General font families for common tags */
font,th,td,p { font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif }
a:link,a:active,a:visited { color : #006699; }
a:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }
hr	{ height: 0px; border: solid #D1D7DC 0px; border-top-width: 1px;}

/* This is the border line & background colour round the entire page */
.bodyline	{ background-color: #FFFFFF; border: 1px #98AAB1 solid; }

/* This is the outline round the main forum tables */
.forumline	{ background-color: #FFFFFF; border: 2px #006699 solid; }

/* Main table cell colours and backgrounds */
td.row1	{ background-color: #EFEFEF; }
td.row2	{ background-color: #DEE3E7; }
td.row3	{ background-color: #D1D7DC; }

/*
  This is for the table cell above the Topics, Post & Last posts on the index.php page
  By default this is the fading out gradiated silver background.
  However, you could replace this with a bitmap specific for each forum
*/
td.rowpic {
		background-color: #FFFFFF;
		background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic2.jpg);
		background-repeat: repeat-y;
}

/* Header cells - the blue and silver gradient backgrounds */
th	{
	color: #FFA34F; font-size: 11px; font-weight : bold;
	background-color: #006699; height: 25px;
	background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic3.gif);
}

td.cat,td.catHead,td.catSides,td.catLeft,td.catRight,td.catBottom {
			background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic1.gif);
			background-color:#D1D7DC; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid; height: 28px;
}

/*
  Setting additional nice inner borders for the main table cells.
  The names indicate which sides the border will be on.
  Don't worry if you don't understand this, just ignore it :-)
*/
td.cat,td.catHead,td.catBottom {
	height: 29px;
	border-width: 0px 0px 0px 0px;
}
th.thHead,th.thSides,th.thTop,th.thLeft,th.thRight,th.thBottom,th.thCornerL,th.thCornerR {
	font-weight: bold; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid; height: 28px;
}
td.row3Right,td.spaceRow {
	background-color: #D1D7DC; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid;
}

th.thHead,td.catHead { font-size: 12px; border-width: 1px 1px 0px 1px; }
th.thSides,td.catSides,td.spaceRow	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 1px; }
th.thRight,td.catRight,td.row3Right	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 0px; }
th.thLeft,td.catLeft	  { border-width: 0px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thBottom,td.catBottom  { border-width: 0px 1px 1px 1px; }
th.thTop	 { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 0px; }
th.thCornerL { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thCornerR { border-width: 1px 1px 0px 0px; }

/* The largest text used in the index page title and toptic title etc. */
.maintitle	{
	font-weight: bold; font-size: 22px; font-family: "Trebuchet MS",Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	text-decoration: none; line-height : 120%; color : #000000;
}

/* General text */
.gen { font-size : 12px; }
.genmed { font-size : 11px; }
.gensmall { font-size : 10px; }
.gen,.genmed,.gensmall { color : #000000; }
a.gen,a.genmed,a.gensmall { color: #006699; text-decoration: none; }
a.gen:hover,a.genmed:hover,a.gensmall:hover	{ color: #DD6900; text-decoration: underline; }

/* The register, login, search etc links at the top of the page */
.mainmenu		{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000 }
a.mainmenu		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699;  }
a.mainmenu:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Forum category titles */
.cattitle		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px ; letter-spacing: 1px; color : #006699}
a.cattitle		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.cattitle:hover{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* Forum title: Text and link to the forums used in: index.php */
.forumlink		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink 	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Used for the navigation text, (Page 1,2,3 etc) and the navigation bar when in a forum */
.nav			{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000;}
a.nav			{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.nav:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* titles for the topics: could specify viewed link colour too */
.topictitle,h1,h2	{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000; }
a.topictitle:link   { text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.topictitle:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.topictitle:hover	{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Name of poster in viewmsg.php and viewtopic.php and other places */
.name			{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000;}

/* Location, number of posts, post date etc */
.postdetails		{ font-size : 10px; color : #000000; }

/* The content of the posts (body of text) */
.postbody { font-size : 12px; line-height: 18px}
a.postlink:link	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699 }
a.postlink:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.postlink:hover { text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900}

/* Quote & Code blocks */
.code {
	font-family: Courier, 'Courier New', sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #006600;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

.quote {
	font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #444444; line-height: 125%;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

/* Copyright and bottom info */
.copyright		{ font-size: 10px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: #444444; letter-spacing: -1px;}
a.copyright		{ color: #444444; text-decoration: none;}
a.copyright:hover { color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;}

/* Form elements */
input,textarea, select {
	color : #000000;
	font: normal 11px Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	border-color : #000000;
}

/* The text input fields background colour */
input.post, textarea.post, select {
	background-color : #FFFFFF;
}

input { text-indent : 2px; }

/* The buttons used for bbCode styling in message post */
input.button {
	background-color : #EFEFEF;
	color : #000000;
	font-size: 11px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}

/* The main submit button option */
input.mainoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : bold;
}

/* None-bold submit button */
input.liteoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : normal;
}

/* This is the line in the posting page which shows the rollover
  help line. This is actually a text box, but if set to be the same
  colour as the background no one will know ;)
*/
.helpline { background-color: #DEE3E7; border-style: none; }

/* Import the fancy styles for IE only (NS4.x doesn't use the @import function) */
@import url("https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/formIE.css");
-->
]] ></style>
  </head>

<script><![CDATA[ if (window.archive_analytics) { window.archive_analytics.values['server_name']="wwwb-app17.us.archive.org";}; ]] ></script><script type="text/javascript" src="https://web.archive.org/static/js/disclaim-element.js"/><script type="text/javascript" src="https://web.archive.org/static/js/graph-calc.js"/><script type="text/javascript" src="https://web.archive.org/static/jflot/jquery.min.js"/><script type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[
//<![CDATA[
var firstDate = 820454400000;
var lastDate = 1420070399999;
var wbPrefix = "/web/";
var wbCurrentUrl = "http:\/\/www.doom3world.org\/phpbb2\/viewtopic.php?p=41764";

var curYear = -1;
var curMonth = -1;
var yearCount = 18;
var firstYear = 1996;
var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;
var trackerVal = "none";
var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Did you edit the basepath in the first line of the scene.txt? 				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=37100&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Yes I edit the scene file and unzip the textures but the program dont load the textures. This is the complete root where i unzip the models and animation of the monsters and i write this in the scene file C:\Models\model\md5\monsters and the textures are in C:\Models\model\monsters.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=37128&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#37128"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Tue Aug 17, 2004 5:05 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=37128&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Ok, the basepath in the scene.txt should be "c:\models\", and the folder that you named "model" has to be renamed to "models", so that your models and textures are in c:\models\models\...
<br/>
That's because the folder in the base folder has to be named "models", if you don't want to edit all the shader names in the md5 files. The point is that the shader names have to give the modelviewer a clue as to where the textures are (relative to the basepath).<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/> Staff</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=5474" target="_blank" class="postlink">Modelviewer  |  3DSMax<->MD5  |  Blender<->MD5</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=41764#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Take a look at the debuglog.txt, there you can read where the modelviewer attempts to read the tgas from.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/> Staff</a>

		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=37195&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#37195"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Tue Aug 17, 2004 7:14 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=37195&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Finally the texture of the models load. I have edited the md5mesh file and add this "/" in the beginning of the string in each shader line, this is  an example of the new line <span style="color: green">"/models/monsters/hellknight/hellknight"</span>. Thanks for all help.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=37238&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#37238"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Tue Aug 17, 2004 8:39 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=37238&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">It's easier if you put the basepath correct. That would be "c:\models\" instead of "c:\models", for example.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/> Staff</a>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="38749"/><b>Chesh</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">is connecting to Doom3world.org<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 20 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1<br/></span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=38749&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#38749"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Aug 20, 2004 6:27 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=38749&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Feel Free to yell at me if this has been asked, but do the alphas work?
<br/><br/>
I had to set the paths up as folows to get the texuters to work, so maybe it has something to do with it.
<br/><br/>
I set the path to find the base folder  "c:\doom3\base
<br/><br/>
then i put the unpaked models folder in my doom3/base folder.
<br/><br/>
This is the only way i could get to textures to work, but the alphas do not.
<br/><br/>
I really dig this lil viewer btw, but i could use a lil help with this.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=41764#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=3882&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=3882&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=38821&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#38821"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Aug 20, 2004 9:40 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=38821&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">I'm not sure what you mean with alphas. The textures that are semitranslucent/blended? They should load up and display completely opaque, because I'm not checking the material definitions to see how they should be rendered. 
<br/>
You might have to make a copy of the md5mesh and change the shader line to directly reference the diffuse color tga. In order to find out which tga that is, you have to first look up the material definition of that shader (in one of the material files, for monsters its monsters.mtr).<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/> Staff</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=5474" target="_blank" class="postlink">Modelviewer  |  3DSMax<->MD5  |  Blender<->MD5</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=41764#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="41696"/><b>Giggione</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">is connecting to Doom3world.org<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 21 Aug 2004<br/>Posts: 1<br/></span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=41696&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#41696"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Wed Aug 25, 2004 4:58 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=41696&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">A littel question?
<br/><br/>
I must extract the content of all pak files in order to view the doom 3 models <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_eek.gif" alt="Shocked" border="0"/>  ??</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=41764#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=3981&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=3981&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>     <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="41764"/><b>der_ton</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">Camper<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/31467175940cee9f963bdc.jpg" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 27 Jun 2003<br/>Posts: 2437<br/>Location: Munich, Germany</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=41764&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b#41764"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Wed Aug 25, 2004 7:10 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=41764&sid=068d1428f1f729c32f797a2391e67e4b"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
bozo wrote:
@der_ton

nice work

thanks for it, it was useful for my lw2md5 converter development, so after my step to the new fileformat i could check the generated md5 file fast

Yup that's the way I use it too. Without it, I would get grey hairs developing the max exporter.
Checking the model in Doom3 takes alot longer because of the loadtimes, and there's other stuff that can go wrong, like entity defs and all that...

post.author: ukrul
post.body: I cant see the texture on the models, Why? I try change the root in the md5mesh file but the texture dont load.I unzip the pak002 in C:\Model.

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Did you edit the basepath in the first line of the scene.txt? And did you unzip the textures, too?

post.author: ukrul
post.body: Yes I edit the scene file and unzip the textures but the program dont load the textures. This is the complete root where i unzip the models and animation of the monsters and i write this in the scene file C:\Models\model\md5\monsters and the textures are in C:\Models\model\monsters.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Ok, the basepath in the scene.txt should be "c:\models\", and the folder that you named "model" has to be renamed to "models", so that your models and textures are in c:\models\models\...
That's because the folder in the base folder has to be named "models", if you don't want to edit all the shader names in the md5 files. The point is that the shader names have to give the modelviewer a clue as to where the textures are (relative to the basepath).

post.author: ukrul
post.body: I change the folder and i edit again th scene file but nothing happens, thanks der_ton for your answer.

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Take a look at the debuglog.txt, there you can read where the modelviewer attempts to read the tgas from.

post.author: ukrul
post.body: Finally the texture of the models load. I have edited the md5mesh file and add this "/" in the beginning of the string in each shader line, this is an example of the new line "/models/monsters/hellknight/hellknight". Thanks for all help.

post.author: der_ton
post.body: It's easier if you put the basepath correct. That would be "c:\models\" instead of "c:\models", for example.

post.author: Chesh
post.body:
Feel Free to yell at me if this has been asked, but do the alphas work?

I had to set the paths up as folows to get the texuters to work, so maybe it has something to do with it.

I set the path to find the base folder "c:\doom3\base

then i put the unpaked models folder in my doom3/base folder.

This is the only way i could get to textures to work, but the alphas do not.

I really dig this lil viewer btw, but i could use a lil help with this.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I'm not sure what you mean with alphas. The textures that are semitranslucent/blended? They should load up and display completely opaque, because I'm not checking the material definitions to see how they should be rendered.
You might have to make a copy of the md5mesh and change the shader line to directly reference the diffuse color tga. In order to find out which tga that is, you have to first look up the material definition of that shader (in one of the material files, for monsters its monsters.mtr).

post.author: Giggione
post.body:
A littel question?

I must extract the content of all pak files in order to view the doom 3 models ??

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Yes, to view a particular model, you only have to extract the md5mesh file, along with that model's textures if you want to see them. At this point, the viewer doesn't load models and textures from within the pk4 files.

post.author: DaNg3R
post.body:
why i'm not able to watch the textures??

i extracted md5 files and animations but...........

maybe i should extract textures too...

reply plz

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Right, you have to extract the textures too. Like I wrote in the viewer's readme, it doesn't extract the pk4 files automatically.

In some cases, the shader names do not correspond with the tga names (because the shader references the tgas in the .mtr files). The modelviewer doesn't read these .mtr files, and some textures will not display unless you modify the shader in the md5 file (make a copy and edit it with a text editor).

post.author: DaNg3R
post.body: tnx 1k

post.author: CHaSE
post.body:
der_ton
Could you please add a viewer version number to the rar archive name and update the first post of the thread? Just to make things less confusing when looking for a latest version...

post.author: der_ton
post.body: Not a bad idea. But that means that the download URL will change with every version. And people will have to check at least the first post of the thread anyway to see if there's a new version. But yep, I'll do that with the next release.

post.author: KPixel
post.body:
You can solve this problem by having each file with its version + a "modelviewer_lastest.rar" that you overwrite at each release so that those that want the lastest version just pick this one...
And I think that it is important that the first post is edited at each release to tell what is the last version available.

post.author: Slogbog
post.body: If i have an .ase file that i want to view with normal maps applied, how do the .mtl files work? i can't really figure it out...

post.author: Slogbog
post.body:
when i load it the model either looks black or looks wierd and choppy, like u see random triangles being ignored by the lighting. One way or another it never really looks like rendering the normal map.
i looked in the debuglog, it does this:
Code:
readmeshfromfile starting, opening file: C:\modelviewer\Imp\Imp4_lo.ASE


then a whole lot of these...

Code:
identical verts: 0, 391, 393
identical verts: 0, 391, 442
identical verts: 0, 391, 443
identical verts: 0, 393, 442

identical verts: 0, 394, 399
identical verts: 0, 395, 397
identical verts: 0, 396, 403
identical verts: 0, 398, 400
identical verts: 0, 404, 406


and then when theyre all done and summed up it does a much longer list of these....

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: I MAY SOUND STUPID BUT IM TRYING TO CREATE CUTSCENES FOR MY NEW MAP USING der_TONS MOD VIEWER AND I CAN LOAD THE MD5 MESH MODEL OF THE Doom 3 Marine but his texture isnt there whats the problem

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: ok i found the textures but when i load it on the model it looks deformed how can i fix it any advice would be great

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: Smoothing doesn't appear to be working on *.LWO models where as it does in Doom 3.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
DiamondDave23 wrote:
ok i found the textures but when i load it on the model it looks deformed how can i fix it any advice would be great

Most probably you're not loading the correct texture. When it looks deformed, I guess that the UV layouts of the texture and the model don't match.

rich_is_bored wrote:
Smoothing doesn't appear to be working on *.LWO models where as it does in Doom 3.

Can you tell me which LWO, and maybe take a screenshot? I did a bit of testing and most objects looked ok, with a few minor issues with the symmetry seam or discontinuous texturing.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Actually, I made a custom *.LWO for use with the material editor and that was the model I tested the your new modelviewer with.

I'll send it VIA email.

Just keep in mind that the model has a dummy shader name. There wasn't much point in creating a material shader for a model that was just going to display whatever material is selected in the material editor.

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: der ton on page 4 you spoke of changing a shader line on the player.md5mesh so it would recognize the upper body textures what was it you changed by the way thanks for all your help lately i really appreciate it seriously

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

post.author: RedEyes
post.body:
Hi all!

I have to suggest some new features for der_ton model viewer to improve a better workflow when you work with it.

* priority
** secondary

-=Workflow=-

*
- Read config model in def files for quick navigation between model's sequences.
- Display names of bones in a short list dialog to select bones and highlightning the bone selected in viewport's model viewer, i suggest a new tab called Bones.

**
- Move to player view for better preview weapons animation.


-=Render=-

*
- Sketch render (uniform lightning) like this :

- Hide geometry for better understanding rigging model (bones only)

**
- Display influence Bones (weight map)


-=Textures=-

**
- New Materials tab to display model's texture on model viewer viewport.


If you have any other suggest for improve model viewer you can post it here =)

Bye!

Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2524
Location: Munich, Germany
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

der_ton
 Post subject:
Posted: Mon Jul 11, 2005 9:53 am 
Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2524
Location: Munich, Germany
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.

_________________
Staff
Modelviewer | 3DSMax<->MD5 | Blender<->MD5

Hi all!

I have to suggest some new features for der_ton model viewer to improve a better workflow when you work with it.

* priority
** secondary

-=Workflow=-

*
- Read config model in def files for quick navigation between model's sequences.
- Display names of bones in a short list dialog to select bones and highlightning the bone selected in viewport's model viewer, i suggest a new tab called Bones.

**
- Move to player view for better preview weapons animation.


-=Render=-

*
- Sketch render (uniform lightning) like this :

- Hide geometry for better understanding rigging model (bones only)

**
- Display influence Bones (weight map)


-=Textures=-

**
- New Materials tab to display model's texture on model viewer viewport.


If you have any other suggest for improve model viewer you can post it here =)

Bye!

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

post.author: doomkid3000
post.body: link broken

post.author: Dogstar
post.body: No it ain't. I just downloaded the file.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Nice work, macbearchen!
And it's a bit faster than my viewer.
About the system requirements: it worked for me even though I don't have a Traditional Chinese Windows. Maybe there's some nonstandard font necessary that I happen to have installed.

What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

post.author: macbearchen
post.body:
Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: I MAY SOUND STUPID BUT IM TRYING TO CREATE CUTSCENES FOR MY NEW MAP USING der_TONS MOD VIEWER AND I CAN LOAD THE MD5 MESH MODEL OF THE Doom 3 Marine but his texture isnt there whats the problem

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
A new version is available. Some of the improvements:

- reads LWO files
- you can now browse for textures that the viewer was not able to find. Alot better than editing your "shader" and "*BITMAP" lines
- shadows are alot faster (on hardware that supports twosided stencil)
- reads compressed TGAs (like the ones ROE uses occasionally)

http://home.mnet-online.de/der/modelviewer.rar

post.author: DiamondDave23
post.body: ok i found the textures but when i load it on the model it looks deformed how can i fix it any advice would be great

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body: Smoothing doesn't appear to be working on *.LWO models where as it does in Doom 3.

post.author: der_ton
post.body:
DiamondDave23 wrote:
ok i found the textures but when i load it on the model it looks deformed how can i fix it any advice would be great

Most probably you're not loading the correct texture. When it looks deformed, I guess that the UV layouts of the texture and the model don't match.

rich_is_bored wrote:
Smoothing doesn't appear to be working on *.LWO models where as it does in Doom 3.

Can you tell me which LWO, and maybe take a screenshot? I did a bit of testing and most objects looked ok, with a few minor issues with the symmetry seam or discontinuous texturing.

post.author: rich_is_bored
post.body:
Actually, I made a custom *.LWO for use with the material editor and that was the model I tested the your new modelviewer with.

I'll send it VIA email.

Just keep in mind that the model has a dummy shader name. There wasn't much point in creating a material shader for a model that was just going to display whatever material is selected in the material editor.

Hi, I also write a md5mesh viewer at
md5mesh_macbear.zip

The program is use to demo the bumpmap, perpixel lighting via real-time 3D graphics

=== 3D Graphics technology ===
1. shadow-volume
2. many dynamic lights, and single ambient light
3. bumpmap with diffuse and specular map
4. Support 3D model by md5mesh format (used in DOOM3), and md5anim animation file
5. Support 3D model by ASE format (3DSMAX ASE file export)

=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD
* 3D card:
nVidia Geforce Card from Geforce/Geforce2/2MX/3Ti/4200Ti or later
ATi Radeon 7x00/8500/9x00 or later
-----------------------------------------
I use some render-path for different Graphics cards:
2 texture-units card: use alpha buffer to temporary store bumpmap, then blend with diffuse and do specular pass
4 texture-units card: render-path for specular pass via ATi and nVidia

I read many useful posts here, and write the program.
Any comment is welcome.

ps: The file is located on geocities, data transfer quota is limited.
So if you can't download it right now, try again later. Sorry...

Quote:
=== System requirement ===
* Windows XP/2000/98/ME Traditional Chinese with OpenGL 1.3 ICD

I think any language version of Windows could run the program, but you may see strange-code on screen-text if you don't have Tranditional Chinese language Windows. You could read "readme.txt" about English usage of my program.
Quote:
What's your render method for projected spotlights? Do you cull geometry that's outside of the light's frustum?

About projected spotlights, just bind it in 4th texUnit
tex#0: NormalMap
tex#1: Cubemap for NormalMap
tex#2: Diffusemap (then Specularmap at second pass)
tex#3: 2D Spotlights map (3D tex is workable if you care about vertical attenuation by light)
For 2 texUnits card:
Need more twice pass as above.
tex#0,#1 at first pass to alpha-buffer
tex#2,#3 at second pass to blend with alpha-buffer.
Then do again for specularmap

About Cull, sure! Mesh would be culled if outside light's frustum or outside camera's frustum.

I also have many improvement to do in the future. Such as:
a. use fragment program to do single pass(w/diffuse, specular) per light
b. use two-side stencil (UltraShadow via nVidia)
c. use vertex program
d. etc...

Doom3 uses a material system to get the correct look and the location of the texture files. My viewer doesn't, for simplicity's sake.

You will have to extract the textures from pak002.pk4, and then edit the "shader" lines in a .md5mesh file to point directly to the correct textures.

There are a couple of explanations on page 4 of this thread, too. I hope that helps.

der_ton
 Post subject:
Posted: Mon Jul 11, 2005 9:53 am 
Plasma Spammer

Joined: Fri Jun 27, 2003 10:24 pm
Posts: 2524
Location: Munich, Germany
I changed the line that says
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body2"

to
Code:
shader "models/characters/player/body"


There is a material named "models/characters/player/body2" that references the same textures as the shader "models/characters/player/body" material, and these textures are the files "models/characters/player/body.tga", "..._local.tga" and so on. You have to extract those from the pak002.pk4 aswell, btw.
